Process Mining 101 Phil Walker 2020-04-02 Chapter 1 Welcome This book aims to document what I’ve been learning about process mining/ process mapping and then be a place to share with others There are different tools available, but the one we will largely focus on exists within the R ecosystem. It is called bupaR (Business Process Analysis in R) and the documentation site for that package and the rest of the ‘-verse’ can be found at [http://bupar.net/] 1.1 Disclaimers I am not a process mining 1.2 What this book is 1.3 What this book is not 1.4 Contact Please feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions or have found and error. I am planning on trying to keep this as up to date as possible and would love to hear from you. My contact information can be found at the top right of the document and I can be reached via twitter, linkedin Best, -phil

Chapter 4 Methods 4.1 How to install bupaR

Chapter 4 Methods We describe our methods in this chapter. This could show the different tools that are available or even some examples 4.1 How to install bupaR The following code should be run initally to install the install.packages("bupaR") install.packages("edeaR") install.packages("eventdataR") install.packages("processmapR") install.packages("processanimateR") install.packages("petrinetR") install.packages("processmonitR") install.packages("processcheckR")
Chapter 5 Applications In this section we are going to try to cover some more detail around what tools are currently available focusing on the open source tools
